content:
• Wednesday, June 29, 2011
  • EBAY

    A big beneficiary of the decision on debit card fees: Shares of eBay (EBAY +5.5%), owners of the...

    A big beneficiary of the decision on debit card fees: Shares of eBay (EBAY +5.5%), owners of the PayPal system, spike on a large volume increase.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • V

    The Fed will allow a base debit card swipe fee of 21 cents, higher than an initial proposed cap...

    The Fed will allow a base debit card swipe fee of 21 cents, higher than an initial proposed cap of 7-12 cents. The new rule would go into effect on October 1. Visa (NYSE:V) and Mastercard (NYSE:MA) say "yes."  V +10.1%, MA +9.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 4 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home (KBH -15%) gets pounded after reporting expanded 2Q losses, with revenues plunging 27%....

    KB Home (KBH -15%) gets pounded after reporting expanded 2Q losses, with revenues plunging 27%. The company's backlog, an indication of future business, fell 24%, while cancellation rates edge up to 25% due to tightened credit standards. (PHM -4.5%)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • MON

    Fertilizer company shares climb after Monsanto (MON +4.3%) sets the tone with strong earnings:...

    Fertilizer company shares climb after Monsanto (MON +4.3%) sets the tone with strong earnings: POT +3.8%, MOS +4.7%, AGU +1.2%, CF +2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • TAOM

    You haven't taken your eye off recent Chinese IPOs, have you (or are you short)? After a weak...

    You haven't taken your eye off recent Chinese IPOs, have you (or are you short)? After a weak debut earlier this month, children's online entertainment company Taomee Holdings (NYSE:TAOM) up 11.5% today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • MON

    Shares of Monsanto (MON +4.2%) shrug off word of an SEC investigation into its herbicide...

    Shares of Monsanto (MON +4.2%) shrug off word of an SEC investigation into its herbicide business, and move higher after it beats Q3 estimates. The company says it's cooperating with a probe centering on customer incentive programs under the Roundup label.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • C

    BofA analysts see long-term value in Citigroup (C +2.8%), upgrading the shares and noting that...

    BofA analysts see long-term value in Citigroup (C +2.8%), upgrading the shares and noting that "stock weakness post May 6th reverse split has provided an attractive entry point." A caveat: Citi won’t reach new Basel capital requirements until 2013, and returns will be "limited" until the 9.5% target is passed.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (ERTS +4.3%) sees a strong future for its games on the upcoming Wii U platform...

    Electronic Arts (ERTS +4.3%) sees a strong future for its games on the upcoming Wii U platform from Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY). The firm says HD graphics and touch-enabled screens on the new Wii fit its franchise games. But shares likely are popping on Zynga-fueled excitement over speculated valuations for publishers of social games.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • TMXXF

    TMX Group (TMXGF.PK -1.9%) and the London Stock Exchange (OTCPK:LDNXF) end their trans-Atlantic...

    TMX Group (TMXGF.PK -1.9%) and the London Stock Exchange (OTCPK:LDNXF) end their trans-Atlantic merger deal on weak shareholder support. (WSJ)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • AWAY

    Online vacation rental website HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY) keeps the low-float IPO trend intact,...

    Online vacation rental website HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY) keeps the low-float IPO trend intact, jumping 50% on its first day of trading and giving it a market cap over $3B.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • OMN

    Specialty chemicals maker Omnova's (OMN -14%) sinks after missing earnings expectations, as the...

    Specialty chemicals maker Omnova's (OMN -14%) sinks after missing earnings expectations, as the recurring theme of higher raw material costs and weak demand hurt its bottom-line in Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • RBYCF

    Rubicon Resources (RBY -15.5%) gets hammered after the preliminary assessment of its F2 gold...

    Rubicon Resources (RBY -15.5%) gets hammered after the preliminary assessment of its F2 gold project discloses another drop in total resources. Although the mine is still viable, it's going to take longer than expected to pay for construction costs out of production.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • DANG

    Dangdang (DANG +9%) announces changes to its senior management structure with the resignation of...

    Dangdang (DANG +9%) announces changes to its senior management structure with the resignation of its COO for personal reasons, and the creation of a separate baby, children and maternity unit to oversee one of the largest growth segments of its business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 3 Comments
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (RST +4.4%) gains after adding five new languages to its technology-based teaching...

    Rosetta Stone (RST +4.4%) gains after adding five new languages to its technology-based teaching solution. Rosetta lost a legal battle against Google (GOOG +0.7%) recently over trademarks, but stays aggressive with new advanced study tools for Mandarin and Russian, as well as apps for iPhones and iPads.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • PRTK

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +5.9%) jumps on an upgrade from Lazard. The firm expects FDA...

    Transcept Pharmaceuticals (TSPT +5.9%) jumps on an upgrade from Lazard. The firm expects FDA approval in July for its Intermezzo insomnia treatment, designed to treat intermittent waking vs. peers Ambien (NASDAQ:SNY) and Lunesta (SEPR), which require at least seven hours for heavy sleep.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • EXFO

    Network test and assurance company EXFO (EXFO -15.4%) posts EPS of $0.03 vs. an expected $0.06....

    Network test and assurance company EXFO (EXFO -15.4%) posts EPS of $0.03 vs. an expected $0.06. Despite the miss, sales are up 21% and gross margin rose to 64.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • AUDC

    Voice-over-IP provider Audiocodes Limited (AUDC +9.2% to $5.23) upgraded to Outperform with a $6...

    Voice-over-IP provider Audiocodes Limited (AUDC +9.2% to $5.23) upgraded to Outperform with a $6 price target by Oppenheimer; the stock's up 20% over three days.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • SM

    SM Energy (SM +6.1%) pops after announcing an agreement to sell 12.5% of its interest in its...

    SM Energy (SM +6.1%) pops after announcing an agreement to sell 12.5% of its interest in its non-operated Eagle Ford oil shale holding for ~$680M. The firm says 2011 production will still beat its current forecast. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • CRIC

    China Real Estate Information (CRIC +8.9%) drifting up on light volume; it's one of a few...

    China Real Estate Information (CRIC +8.9%) drifting up on light volume; it's one of a few companies that are part of Baidu's (NASDAQ:BIDU) recent strategic deals for premier partnerships and it has exclusive rights to sell Bidu's real estate brandlink product. It's a 2009 creation of units of E-House China (NYSE:EJ) and Sina (NASDAQ:SINA).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • SBGL

    Platinum producer Stillwater Mining (SWC +1.8%) says it's reached a tentative agreement with the...

    Platinum producer Stillwater Mining (SWC +1.8%) says it's reached a tentative agreement with the United Steel Workers on the terms of a new four-year labor deal at its Stillwater Mine and Processing Facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • BAC

    Financial stocks (XLF +1.1%) surge to the top of the early leader board after Bank of America's...

    Financial stocks (XLF +1.1%) surge to the top of the early leader board after Bank of America's (BAC +3.1%) deal to pay an $8.5B settlement to mortgage investors. Prevailing sentiment: "If BofA can settle on $424B of bonds for $8.5B, that’s 2%, which is a screaming bargain." Also: C +2.4%, JPM +2.1%, WFC +1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • SHAW

    SHAW is downgraded at Stifel Nicolaus following a disastrous earnings report late yesterday. The...

    SHAW is downgraded at Stifel Nicolaus following a disastrous earnings report late yesterday. The company expects to show a loss in Q3 as nuclear-related projects dry up in the wake of the TEPCO disaster. Shares -10.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • CPB

    Campbell Soup (CPB +2.1%) bails out of Russia after profits disappoint, but sets its sights on...

    Campbell Soup (CPB +2.1%) bails out of Russia after profits disappoint, but sets its sights on China as a growth market opportunity. The firm likes the 320B bowls of soup consumed in China, compared to just 14B in the U.S., and has reformulated a stronger chicken broth to appeal to the Chinese market.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 3 Comments
  • SPRD

    Premarket gainers: SPRD +14%. ZZ +14%. MMR +8%. NBG +7%. LOGI +5%. BJ-OLD +5%. YOKU +5%. PMI...

    Premarket gainers: SPRD +14%. ZZ +14%. MMR +8%. NBG +7%. LOGI +5%. BJ-OLD +5%. YOKU +5%. PMI +4%. RENN +4%. BCS +4%. BAC +4%. ING +3%. STD +3%. MTG +3%. IRE +3%. X +3%. DANG +3%. BBVA +3%. AKS +3%. MPEL +3%.
    Losers: RBY -15%. SHAW -13%. ASX -3%. KBH -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 7 Comments
  • PDEX

    Pro-Dex (NASDAQ:PDEX) loses one of its largest customers, which plans to develop and eventually...

    Pro-Dex (NASDAQ:PDEX) loses one of its largest customers, which plans to develop and eventually manufacture two surgical devices that are functionally comparable to its own, sending shares -19.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM

  • Euro and European shares momentarily plummet before stabilizing and bouncing a bit as 'no' votes...

    Euro and European shares momentarily plummet before stabilizing and bouncing a bit as 'no' votes are slightly ahead of 'yes' votes in Athens. Visual of the euro move. Euro at $1.4375. Stoxx 50 +1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ2 EPS of -$0.89 misses by $0.58. Revenue of $271.7M (-27.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ2 EPS of -$0.89 misses by $0.58. Revenue of $271.7M (-27.4% Y/Y) beats by $25.1M. Shares -4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • MON

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON): FQ3 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $3.59B (+21.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Monsanto (NYSE:MON): FQ3 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $3.59B (+21.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.21B. Sees FY'11 EPS of $2.84-2.88. Shares +3.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM
  • SPRD

    After falling 30% yesterday and then making a near-total recovery, Spreadtrum (SPRD +7.9%) is...

    After falling 30% yesterday and then making a near-total recovery, Spreadtrum (SPRD +7.9%) is holding a conference call now. You can listen live here. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 AM
  • BJ-OLD

    BJ's Wholesale (NYSE:BJ-OLD) accepts an offer to be acquired by Leonard Green and CVC Capital...

    BJ's Wholesale (NYSE:BJ-OLD) accepts an offer to be acquired by Leonard Green and CVC Capital for $51.25/share, or ~$2.8B. It marks a 38% premium to the stock's closing price on June 30, 2010, the day before Leonard Green announced its 9.5% ownership stake. Shares +5.4% to $50.69. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 AM
  • BAC

    "This is another important step we are taking in the interest of our shareholders to minimize...

    "This is another important step we are taking in the interest of our shareholders to minimize the impact of future economic uncertainty and put legacy issues behind us," says BofA (BAC +3.7%) CEO Brian Moynihan. "We will continue to act aggressively, and in the best interest of our shareholders, to clean up the mortgage issues largely stemming from our purchase of Countrywide." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM
  • BAC

    BofA (NYSE:BAC) and Countrywide agree to pay $8.5B to settle mortgage claims. BAC +3.05%...

    BofA (NYSE:BAC) and Countrywide agree to pay $8.5B to settle mortgage claims. BAC +3.05% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 AM
